Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 12:05. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a an overhead transformer that we will be replacing and upgrading with a new ground mounted transformer. Doing this will ensure the network can uphold the increased electricity usage and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we install the new transformer. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. We aim to connect and disconnect the generator as soon as possible so your power may come on sooner. This work is taking place near Ringland Road.

Sent by Decasta at 12:42 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repair a fault on the underground network in the Lower Farm Road KT24 5 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused again today.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 11:40 - Our engineers have investigated and found that the power is off due to a fault on our underground electricity network which has affected our substation equipment, specialist teams are on site to pinpoint the fault and dig down to expose the cabling for repairs.

Considering the work that may be required, the revised estimated time to have the power back on is between 17:00 and 18:00.

We're sorry to change the time, but we'll keep you updated with our progress. If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always here to talk on 105.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 11:57 - Our engineers have completed their investigations.

There's going to be a lot of work required to repair the issue safely, so we have decided to use temporary generators to provide power. 

Although this will be temporary, engineers will still need to repair the issue before it can be removed and network power is resumed. Depending on the fault, it may take several days for our engineers to pinpoint the problem and plan in the work. The temporary generator will remain on site to provide power until we can locate the issue and restore the network back to normal running conditions.

If you'd like any further information, our team are always here to help.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 12:48 - Thanks for your patience over today; I'll be on hand to update you as our staff work on repairs, and I just wanted to give you the latest from site.

We can now confirm that a fallen tree has bought down some of our overhead cables in the Bury St Edmunds IP33 area.

The tree will need removing and the grounded cables re-erecting, so we're sending specialist teams and equipment. To allow time for them to arrive and the repair work completed safely, we're now estimating to have the remaining power back on between 16:30 and 17:30.

Should you have any concerns, please call us on 0800 316 3105, and our team will do their best to help.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Bev at 11:57 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 14 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 11 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 13:20 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the SE25 6 area, the estimated time of 15:00-16:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on.

We know you may be concerned about your phone battery running low, so here are some tips on how you can prolong battery life: Set your phone to power saving mode, reduce screen brightness, turn off WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS (if not in use), cut apps running in the background and if possible top up using a car charger or portable battery pack.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Roland at 09:33 - We can now confirm that all power in the North Hill area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault on our underground network, which our engineers have diverted power around the fault.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Roland at 08:36.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 10:19 - We can now confirm that all power in the Vinery Court area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Vinery Court area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Adam at 09:06.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 07:56 - Our staff are on the way to the Vinery Court area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 11:30 and 12:30. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the West End area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Bev at 12:50.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 12:36 - Our staff are on the way to the West End area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 15:30 and 16:30. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 19:37 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs on the underground network in the Chiltern Place area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 17:33 - Thanks for bearing with us over today. Our team of cable jointers have now identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our digging team are now starting excavations, but due to the surface material and how much space will be needed for our engineers to assess the fault and make their repairs safely, we're now estimating power will be back on by 21:30 and 22:30.

We're sorry to change our time frame, but we'll continue to keep you updated and our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

Sent by Adam at 06:41 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Fens Way area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground network fault, which our engineers diverted power around.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 08:56 - We can now confirm that all power in the Coopers Meadow area should be back to normal.

Upon investigation, the flickering and reduced voltage was caused by a faulty piece of network equipment, which our engineers have now safely diverted power around. We know that interference with your power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the disruption. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.

Sent by Simon at 01:56 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 2190 customers in the Huntingdon area, by repairing an overhead cable fault. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Simon at 01:39
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 00:30 - Our engineers have advised us that they are now progressing with the full repairs to the overhead cable fault. Further to this, our field staff have just told us that 4 properties now have their lights safely back on after connecting a temporary generator. I know there's still some properties affected, so I'll keep sending updates. Our estimated timeframe of 02:30-03:30 has not changed, if you're back up and running now, you can always stop receiving SMS messages from us on our website here: https://bit.ly/348KOZ3. Otherwise, I'll have some more news for you soon.

We're sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on.

We know you may be concerned about your phone battery running low, so here are some tips on how you can prolong battery life: Set your phone to power saving mode, reduce screen brightness, turn off WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS (if not in use), cut apps running in the background and if possible top up using a car charger or portable battery pack.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Roland at 23:02
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 16:07. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Simon at 01:28 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 291 customers in the Great Yarmouth, NR29 area, by repairing an overhead cable fault. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

We're sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on.

We know you may be concerned about your phone battery running low, so here are some tips on how you can prolong battery life: Set your phone to power saving mode, reduce screen brightness, turn off WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS (if not in use), cut apps running in the background and if possible top up using a car charger or portable battery pack.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 00:53 - Thanks for your patience over tonight.

Our team of specialist engineers arrived on site to remove the tree that has fallen and carry out repairs to the grounded overhead cable. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 03:00 and 04:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 00:10 - Thanks for bearing with us tonight, I just wanted to give you the latest from our staff on site.

Our engineers have advised that they have located a tree that has fallen causing an overhead cable that has come down on the ground. They are arranging for extra teams to attend to remove the tree and assist with the repairs. 

At the moment they have offered no adjustment to our estimated time frame of 00:30-01:30. However, due to how long these works may now take, it's possible that this may need to change. We're keeping in regular contact with our staff and as soon as we have more news, we'll update you again.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 08:55 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are currently checking our network equipment throughout the area. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Sent by Decasta at 08:23 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 918 customers in the RH13 8/9 area, by diverting power around the underground cabling fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Decasta at 07:56 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground cabling fault that initially interrupted power to 918 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 61 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 10:30-11:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
